whatIsDao.title: What is a DAO?
whatIsDao.description: A Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) is a blockchain-based governance system where token holders collectively make decisions. Unlike traditional organizations, DAOs operate transparently on the blockchain, with rules enforced by smart contracts rather than centralized authorities.

items.title: Transparent Governance
items.description: All proposals, votes, and treasury transactions are recorded on the blockchain and publicly verifiable

items.title: Automated Execution
items.description: Approved proposals execute automatically through smart contracts, eliminating the need for manual intervention

items.title: Collective Ownership
items.description: Token holders share ownership and decision-making power proportional to their holdings

items.title: Secure Treasury
items.description: Funds are protected by a timelock mechanism, giving members time to react before transactions execute

architecture.title: Your DAO Architecture
architecture.subtitle: CreateDAO deploys three interconnected smart contracts that work together to provide a complete governance system

token.name: Governance Token
token.description: ERC20 token with built-in voting capabilities

architecture.flowDescription: Token holders create and vote on proposals → Governor validates and processes votes → Treasury executes approved transactions

components.title: Core Components
components.subtitle: Each component serves a specific purpose in your DAO's governance system

token.title: Governance Token
token.description: Your governance token is an ERC20-compatible token with built-in voting capabilities. It serves as the foundation of your DAO's decision-making process.
features: Auto-delegation: Voting power is automatically activated when tokens are received
Permit support: Gas-efficient approvals using signatures
Checkpoint history: Secure snapshot-based voting prevents double-voting
Standard ERC20: Compatible with all major wallets and exchanges

governor.title: Governor Contract
governor.description: The Governor is the central hub of your DAO's governance. It coordinates the entire proposal lifecycle from creation to execution.
features: Proposal management: Create, track, and execute governance proposals
Voting system: Secure voting with For, Against, and Abstain options
Quorum enforcement: Ensures minimum participation for valid decisions
Timelock integration: All executions go through the secure treasury

treasury.title: Treasury (Timelock)
treasury.description: The Treasury securely holds your DAO's assets and enforces a mandatory delay before executing approved transactions. This gives members time to react to passed proposals.
features: Asset custody: Holds ETH, ERC20 tokens, and NFTs
Execution delay: 1-day mandatory waiting period for security
Governance-only access: Only approved proposals can move funds
Multi-asset support: Manage diverse portfolios of digital assets

parameters.title: Governance Parameters
parameters.subtitle: Your DAO is deployed with carefully chosen default settings that can be modified through governance proposals

items.label: Creator Allocation
items.description: You receive 1% of tokens to bootstrap governance

items.label: Treasury Allocation
items.description: Majority held in treasury for community distribution

items.label: Quorum
items.description: Minimum participation required for valid votes

items.label: Proposal Threshold
items.description: Minimum tokens needed to create proposals

items.label: Voting Delay
items.description: Time before voting begins after proposal creation

parameters.note: All parameters can be adjusted through governance proposals after deployment

governance.title: How Governance Works
governance.subtitle: The proposal lifecycle from creation to execution

steps.title: Create Proposal
steps.description: Any token holder with 1% or more can submit a proposal describing the action to take

steps.title: Voting Delay
steps.description: A brief waiting period allows members to review the proposal before voting begins

steps.title: Active Voting
steps.description: Token holders cast their votes: For, Against, or Abstain

steps.title: Queue
steps.description: If approved, the proposal is queued in the treasury's timelock

steps.title: Timelock
steps.description: Mandatory security delay gives members time to react if needed

steps.title: Execute
steps.description: After the timelock, anyone can trigger the execution of the approved action

votingOptions.title: Voting Options
votingOptions.abstain: Abstain: Count toward quorum without taking a side

manager.title: DAO Manager
manager.subtitle: Bridging on-chain governance with real-world operations
manager.description: Your DAO includes a Manager role - a designated address that can be verified by external systems for off-chain responsibilities. This enables integration with legal entities, accounting systems, and third-party platforms while maintaining full accountability to on-chain governance.

useCases.title: Use Cases
items: Integration with accounting and treasury management platforms

manager.note: The Manager can only be changed through a governance proposal, ensuring the community always maintains control

security.title: Built on OpenZeppelin
security.subtitle: Industry-standard security you can trust
security.description: Your DAO contracts are built on OpenZeppelin's battle-tested governance framework - the same foundation used by major protocols managing billions of dollars in assets.

features.title: Audited Contracts
features.description: OpenZeppelin contracts are extensively audited and used across the industry

features.title: Gas Efficient
features.description: EIP-1167 minimal proxies reduce deployment costs significantly

features.title: Tally Compatible
features.description: Works with Tally, Snapshot, and other major governance platforms

features.title: Immutable Deployment
